aprove.Framework.IntTRS.Nonterm.GeoNonTerm

Class GNAMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • aprove.Framework.IntTRS.Nonterm.GeoNonTerm.GNAMatrix

  • public class GNAMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a int-matrix and a labeling to the rows and columns.

    The application of it are the update-, guard- and iteration matrices in the Loop used within the Geometric Non Termination Analysis.
    Author:
    Timo Bergerbusch

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • matrix

        private int[][] matrix
        a two dimensional int array to represent the values as a row-major matrix.

        Example: the matrix 
         
        a b
  m = ( c d )
        would be {{a,b},{c,d}}

      • columnNames

        private final java.lang.String[] columnNames
        represents the names of the columns. Typically these are the variable names

      • rowNames

        private final java.lang.String[] rowNames
        represents the names of the rows. Depending if it is a square matrix is could be again the variable names or simple an enumeration.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GNAMatrix

        public GNAMatrix(java.lang.String[] varNames)
        creates a new GNAMatrix.
        It sets the matrix as a square matrix defined by the length of the parameter array length and sets every entry to 0 by default.
        Parameters:
        varNames - the names of the variables

      • GNAMatrix

        public GNAMatrix(int rowDimension,
                 int columnDimension,
                 java.lang.String[] columnNames)
        creates a new GNAMatrix.
        It sets the matrix to the given dimensions, sets the columnNames to the given parameter and initializes the rowNames as a typical enumeration.
        Parameters:
        rowDimension - the row dimension
        columnDimension - the column dimension
        columnNames - the names of the columns

      • GNAMatrix

        public GNAMatrix(int rowDimension,
                 int columnDimension)
        creates a new GNAMatrix.
        It sets the matrix to the given dimensions and initializes the rowNames and columnNames to the corresponding numbers of the rows/columns.
        Parameters:
        rowDimension - the row dimension
        columnDimension - the column dimension

    • Method Detail

      • IdentityMatrix

        public static GNAMatrix IdentityMatrix(int size)
        creates a new square Identity-matrix, which is an GNAMatrix with 1's in the diagonal and 0 else.
        Parameters:
        size - the dimension if the Identity-matrix
        Returns:
        the Identity-matrix

      • negatedMatrixCopy

        public GNAMatrix negatedMatrixCopy()
        returns a matrix like this with every entry multiplied by -1.
        NOTE: this method does not change this matrix's entry's!
        Returns:
        a negated copy of this matrix
        See Also:
        negate()

      • negate

        public GNAMatrix negate()
        negates every matrix entry with -1.
        NOTE: this method changes this matrix's entry's.
        NOTE: the return is needed
        Returns:
        this matrix after it gets negated

      • mult

        public GNAVector mult(GNAVector vec)
        multiplies this GNAMatrix with a given GNAVector
        Parameters:
        vec - the GNAVector this GNAMatrix should be multiplicated with
        Returns:
        the resulting GNAVector

      • mult

        public RPNNode[] mult(GNAVariableVector vec)
        multiplies this GNAMatrix with a GNAVariableVector and generates a RPNTree for every entry of the resulting GNAVariableVector of the multiplication. It does so by multiplying integer coefficients and rewrite formulas like 
         
  c * (x_0 + x_1) < = > c*x_0 + c*x_1
        using GNAVariableVector.getTreeOfVector().
        Parameters:
        vec - the GNAVariableVector
        Returns:
        the resulting GNAVariableVector as RPNTree for every for every entry
        See Also:
        GNAVariableVector.getTreeOfVector(), RPNNode

      • insert

        public void insert(GNAMatrix src,
                   int rowPos,
                   int columnPos)
        inserts a GNAMatrix at a given starting point into this instances #GNAMatrix.
        Parameters:
        src - the GNAMatrix that should be inserted
        rowPos - the row the insertion should start
        columnPos - the column the insertion should start

      • computeEigenvalues

        public int[] computeEigenvalues()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        returns the matrix with it's entries and the labeling of the rows and columns

        Example to the matrix m = {{a,b},{c,d}} and the labels varName= {"x", "y"} 

         
   x y
 x a b
 y c d
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the matrix in the presented form

      • getAsRealMatrix

        public org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix getAsRealMatrix()

      • setEntry

        public void setEntry(int row,
                     int column,
                     int value)
        sets an entry in the matrix using the exact int-values to adress the entry and sets it to the parameter value.
        Parameters:
        row - the row
        column - the column
        value - the new value

      • setEntry

        public void setEntry(java.lang.String rowOf,
                     java.lang.String valueOf,
                     int value)
        sets an entry in the matrix using the names of the row- and column-variables stored in columnNames using getIndex(String) and setEntry(int, int, int)
        Parameters:
        rowOf - the name of the row variable
        valueOf - the name of the column variable
        value - the new value

      • setEntry

        public void setEntry(int rowNumber,
                     java.lang.String varName,
                     int value)
        sets an entry in the matrix using the given row number and variable name using getIndex(String) and setEntry(int, int, int).
        This method is typically used for non-square matrices.
        Parameters:
        rowNumber - the row of the entry
        varName - the corresponding variable
        value - the new value of the entry

      • getEntry

        public int getEntry(int row,
                    int column)
        returns the entry at a requested position.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the entry
        column - the column of the entry
        Returns:
        the value of getMatrix() at matrix[row][column]

      • getIndex

        private int getIndex(java.lang.String key)
        retrieves the index of an entry in columnNames to the given input.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the variables, which's index should be returned
        Returns:
        the index of the key within the columnNames array. Returns null if the value can't be found

        public int rowSize()

      • columnSize

        public int columnSize()
        returns the number of columns of the matrix
